title: Former Punjab Chief Minister Parkash Singh Badal Dies At 95
desc: Parkash Singh Badal, former Punjab Chief Minister and Akali Dal patriarch, died on Tuesday. He was 95.

title: PM Modi To Hold Virtual Meet With 50 Lakh BJP Workers In Karnataka
desc: Prime Minister Narendra Modi would hold an interactive meeting with 50 lakh BJP workers virtually in poll-bound Karnataka on Thursday.

title: Union Minister Alleges Convict Ex MP "Scapegoat" In Nitish Kumar's Play
desc: Union Minister Giriraj Singh has called gangster-turned-politician Anand Mohan Singh a "scapegoat" in the political play of Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, on a day the state government announced that Anand Mohan will be released.

title: Pak Defence Minister To Skip Delhi Trip, Virtually Attend SCO Meet: Report
desc: Pakistan Defence Minister Khawaja Asif is set to skip his India visit and attend the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Defence Ministers' meeting virtually.

title: "Such Dilution Leads To Impunity": IAS Body To Bihar On Release Of Ex MP
desc: The top body of the country's bureaucrats has issued a vociferous protest against the change in rules in Bihar to facilitate the release of gangster-turned-politician Anand Mohan Singh, who was serving a life term for the murder of a Dalit IAS office

title: Rights Panel Notice To Bengal, Police Chief Over Dead Body Dragged By Cops
desc: The NHRC has sent a notice to the West Bengal government and the state's police chief over reports that the body of a girl was allegedly dragged away by police amid protests in Uttar Dinajpur, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Eagerly Awaiting 100th Episode Of Mann Ki Baat: PM On His Radio Programme
desc: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said he was eagerly awaiting the 100th episode of his radio programme 'Mann Ki Baat', scheduled to be broadcast on April 30.

title: Right In Demanding "Major Course Correction" Of Top UN Body: India
desc: India is right in demanding a "major course correction" of the UN Security Council when the world's largest democracy is kept out of the global decision making, the country's UN envoy has said.

title: Gujarat Anti-Terror Squad Gets Custody Of Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi
desc: The Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) has got the custody of jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi in connection with a case of cross-border smuggling of drugs, an official said today.

title: BJP's Is Double Engine, Congress Is Reverse Gear Government: Amit Shah
desc: Taking a jibe at the Congress, Union Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that while the BJP government is a "double-engine" government, Congress is a "reverse-gear" government.

title: "We Brought In A New Work Culture In Last 9 Years": PM Modi
desc: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday targeted previous governments over delayed projects and vote-bank politics, and said his government has ushered in a "new work culture".

title: "Court Will Decide": Wrestling Body Chief On #MeToo Charges Against Him
desc: Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) chief and BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh on Tuesday did not directly reply to questions over protesting wrestlers' allegations against him and said the matter is pending in the Supreme Court.

title: India, China Defence Ministers To Meet On Thursday, 1st Since Galwan Clash
desc: China's Defence Minister General Li Shangfu will meet his Indian counterpart Rajnath Singh in Delhi on Thursday for the first time since troops of the two nations faced a violent clash in eastern Ladakh's Galwan valley in May 2020.

title: India Renews Push For Easier Visas For Its Companies In UK: Report
desc: India will keep pushing for easier visa rules for skilled professionals hired by its companies investing in Britain as it looks to finalise a free trade pact with the UK by end-2023, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Delhi Given 1 Month To Decide On Transgender As 3rd Gender For Bus Travel
desc: Delhi High Court has granted one month's time to the city government authorities to decide a representation to legally recognise transgender community as the third gender in bus tickets issued by the DTC.

title: PM Modi To Address Kashi Telugu Sangamam In Varanasi On April 29
desc: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will virtually address the Kashi Telugu Sangamam event, which will be held in his parliamentary constituency Varanasi, on April 29.

title: Om Birla-Led 17th Lok Sabha Saved Rs 801 Crore Of Its Budget Allocation
desc: Initiatives such as the use of e-vehicles and a paperless office led by Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla saved Rs 801.46 crore in the four years of the 17th Lok Sabha, a Parliament official said today.

title: Rahul Gandhi Goes To Gujarat High Court After No Relief In Defamation Case
desc: Rahul Gandhi Goes To Gujarat High Court Challenging Lower Court Order

title: Sex-Determination Based Abortion Perpetuates Gender Inequalities: Court
desc: Abortion based on sex-determination is a powerful method of perpetuating gender inequalities, the high court said, emphasising the law must have teeth to sternly deal with such situations till attitudinal changes at family level are achieved.

title: UP Board Exam Results Out, Girls Outperform Boys. Details Here
desc: Girls outperformed boys in the high school and intermediate examinations conducted by the Uttar Pradesh Secondary Education Council this year, a senior official of the board said while announcing the results on Tuesday.
